DataElement.preferredName: Preparative Regimen Total-Body Irradiation Planned Administration Total Radiation Therapy Dose
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The numeric value related to the administered total prescribed dose of total body irradiation for the preparative regimen.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Preparative Regimen Total-Body Irradiation Planned Administration
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The chemotherapy and/or radiation given to bone marrow transplant patients prior to transplant to kill diseased cells and/or make space for healthy new marrow and/or suppress the immune system so graft rejection does not occur._Irradiation of the whole body with ionizing or non-ionizing radiation. It is applicable to humans or animals but not to microorganisms._To devise, contrive, or formed in design._The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The chemotherapy and/or radiation given to bone marrow transplant patients prior to transplant to kill diseased cells and/or make space for healthy new marrow and/or suppress the immune system so graft rejection does not occur.:Radiation therapy to the entire body. Usually followed by bone marrow or peripheral stem cell transplantation.

Concepts.definition: The chemotherapy or radiation given prior to blood, marrow, cord blood transplant, or cell infusion to kill diseased cells and make space for the healthy new graft and/or suppress the immune system so rejection does not occur.
A therapeutic procedure that involves the irradiation of the whole body with ionizing or non-ionizing radiation.

Property.preferredDefinition: Planned; devised, contrived, or formed in design.:The act of administration.

Concepts.definition: To devise, contrive, or form in design.
The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Radiation therapy to the entire body. Usually followed by bone marrow or peripheral stem cell transplantation._The cumulative dose amount, in cGy or Rads, administered to each treatment field/site according to protocol.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete.:use PHOTOTHERAPY, LASER THERAPY, or ULTRAVIOLET THERAPY for therapeutic radiation with visible, laser, or ultraviolet light, respectively.:The amount of medicine taken, or radiation given, at one time.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.

Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.
A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.

ClassificationSchemes.longName: Artificial Neural Network Algorithm for BRIDG Mapping

ReferenceDocuments.name: What was the total prescribed
ReferenceDocuments.description: What was the total prescribed cumulative dose of total body irradiation for the preparative regimen (per the protocol)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: BRIDG mapping path for CDE:2684897
ReferenceDocuments.description: PerformedSubstanceAdministration > PlannedActivity > StudyActivity > DefinedSubstanceAdministration.productDose.PQ.value WHERE DefinedSubstanceAdministration.nameCode = "Administer Radiation" AND DefinedSubstanceAdministration.targetAnatomicSiteCode = "total body" AND PerformedSubstanceAdministration > DefinedSubstanceAdministration > DefinedCompositionRelationship > DefinedSubjectActivityGroup.nameCode = "Perform preparative regimen"
